data.question: What is the Curie temperature of the ferromagnetic interaction between Cr(III) and Mn(II) ions?
data.answer: 7 K

data.question: What effect is enhanced by a factor of 17 when entering into the ferromagnetic phase?
data.answer: The magneto-chiral dichroic effect

data.question: What is the role of the resolved chiral quaternary ammonium cation in the synthesis of the enantiopure chiral ferromagnet?
data.answer: It imposes the absolute configurations of the metal centres within chromiumâ€“manganese two-dimensional oxalate layers.

data.question: How does the magneto-chiral dichroism (MChD) effect occur in a material?
data.answer: MChD occurs when the medium interacts with non-polarized light and arises from the coexistence of spatial asymmetry and magnetization in the material.

data.question: What is the significance of the opposite anisotropy in the optical response of the two enantiomers in the ferromagnetic phase?
data.answer: It is direct experimental proof of the existence of the magneto-chiral dichroism effect in the materials.

data.question: What is the relationship between the magneto-chiral dichroism (MChD) signal and the magnetization of the material?
data.answer: The MChD intensity is proportional to the magnetization, showing a strong enhancement at the paramagnetic-to-ferromagnetic phase transition.

data.question: What method was used to measure the magnetic susceptibility of the enantiomers?
data.answer: The magnetic susceptibility was measured using a Quantum Design MPMS5 superconducting quantum interference device magnetometer.

data.question: Why was it crucial to use precursors exhibiting weak absorbance in the visible range for detecting the magneto-chiral dichroism effect?
data.answer: Because it enabled the detection of the effect through optical measurements.

data.question: How does the presence of the chiral carbon atom on one chain of the ammonium cation influence the configuration of the chromium centres?
data.answer: The chiral carbon atom on one chain is enough to twist the corresponding oxalate group and impose the configuration of the chromium centres.

data.question: What is the role of the tetraalkylammonium cation in the enantioselective self-assembly of 2D oxalate-based compounds?
data.answer: The tetraalkylammonium cation controls the dimensionality of the coordination network and the absolute configurations of the chiral metal centres.

data.question: What was the outcome of using the gel technique and the slow diffusion technique in the synthesis of the enantiopure chiral ferromagnets?
data.answer: Both techniques resulted in the successful synthesis of enantiopure transparent single crystals.

data.question: What does the symmetry of the dichroic signals obtained from (S)- and (R)-methyl(1-methylpropyl)di(n-propyl)ammonium iodide indicate?
data.answer: It indicates that the resolved ammonium cation has predominantly interacted with one of the enantiomers of the tris(oxalato)chromate(III) to build optically active single crystals.

data.question: Is the magneto-chiral dichroism effect observed only in the ferromagnetic phase of the material?
data.answer: False, a weak dichroism is observed in the paramagnetic phase, but it significantly increases in the ferromagnetic phase.

data.question: Does the magneto-chiral dichroism effect depend on the polarization of the light interacting with the medium?
data.answer: False, magneto-chiral effects occur when the medium interacts with non-polarized light.

data.question: Are the magnetic properties of the two enantiomers of [N(CH3)(n-C3H7)2(s-C4H9)][MnCr(ox)3] equivalent?
data.answer: True, the magnetic properties of the two enantiomers are equivalent.

data.question: Is the magneto-chiral dichroism signal independent of the magnetization of the material?
data.answer: False, the magneto-chiral dichroism intensity is proportional to the magnetization.

data.question: Can the magneto-chiral dichroism effect be measured using polarized light?
data.answer: False, the magneto-chiral dichroism effect is observed when the medium interacts with non-polarized light.

data.question: Is the Curie temperature of the ferromagnetic interaction between Cr(III) and Mn(II) ions higher than the room temperature?
data.answer: False, the Curie temperature is 7 K, which is much lower than room temperature.

data.question: Does the presence of the chiral carbon atom on the ammonium cation have no influence on the configuration of the chromium centres?
data.answer: False, the presence of the chiral carbon atom on one chain is enough to twist the corresponding oxalate group and impose the configuration of the chromium centres.

data.question: Are the optical properties of the compounds dominated by the absorption of the templating cation?
data.answer: True, in 3D systems, the optical properties of the compounds are dominated by the absorption of the templating cation.
